column3:
<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
Xorutt is short and bearded and ready to brew.
Find clumps of magma grass and collect magma blooms.
Deliver the magma blooms to Xorutt.

Lali-ho! Say, ain't you that <Switch(PlayerParameter(71))><Case(1)>traveler</Case><Case(2)>traveler</Case><Case(3)>foreign dwarf</Case><Case(4)>traveler</Case><Case(5)>traveler</Case><Case(6)>traveler</Case><Case(7)>traveler</Case><Case(8)>traveler</Case></Switch> everyone's been talking about?
Well, lali-ho again and welcome to Tomra! I'm going to treat you to some Tholl hospitality, and I'll not take no for an answer!
First things first: we brew some dwarven ale together! Aye, that'll be a lark!
Now, most folk make their ale from barley, but not us dwarves. We use seeds harvested from the magma grass what grows on the slopes of Mt. Gulg.

Them weeds drink in the sea air from the moment their heads poke out of the dirt to the moment they wilt and die. Gives our grog a tangy flavor you won't never taste in any of that barley-brewed stuff!
So! Let's give you the full experience, shall we? Head on out of the village, and pluck me four or so good-sized magma blooms─they're crammed tight with seeds, don't you know!
...What do magma blooms look like? Well, they're tall and orange and probably a bit sparkly. You'll know when you see 'em.
Well? Did you pluck them blooms like I asked you? Brewing time's a-wasting!
Aye, that's enough seeds to stuff my helm and then some! Good work! This next part of the process is a bit tricky, so let's leave that to an expert. Which would be me.
But don't wander away just yet, my friend! There's more to our traditions than just picking sparkly flowers, and we're just getting started!
